pr_title: Github issue client cleanup & Add "Error Report" label to uploaded issues

timeline.message:
Github issue client cleanup & Add "Error Report" label to uploaded issues

1. Feature: Update automatic issue creation to add a label "Error Report"
   to issues created via the error report functionality. The labels will
   server to more easily identify and organize errors that were uploaded
   from the game client.

   Implementation changes:
   To attach labels we split the create error report object, prevoiusly
   the error report object sent to the HTTP server matched the one we
   sent to github. After splitting the error report request object,
   the 'createIssueRequest' object we send to github to create issues
   can have labels added to it.

2. Cleanup: Update github issue client to be consistent with a well
   named feign client class.

3. Cleanup: Make github issue client upload 'isTest' behavior be internal
   to the client. Before it was the user of the client class that checked
   if the client was in test mode and stubbed a response, now the client
   will transparently return a stubbed response when in test mode.

timeline.bodyText: What about checking !isTest || !configuration.isProd() or !(isTest && configuration.isProd()) instead of the if block?

replies.bodyText: no, it's somewhat arbitrary. This request object is lifted from the error upload request object. Before we had the same request object between client, server, and github. So this limit is just carried forward from that previous object. The fact that they match now I'm not sure is actually important. It still might be better to document that this is an arbitrarily large number.
